intro: Desmoncus campylacanthus, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences. Desmoncus campylacanthus is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
